title: State v. Mark Jensen
summary: Mark Jensen is accused of embezzling funds from his employer, Acme Corporation. The prosecution alleges that Mr. Jensen diverted company funds to a personal account over a period of two years. The defense argues that Mr. Jensen was framed by a disgruntled colleague.

evidence.title: Bank Statements
evidence.description: Bank statements from the defendant's personal account showing large, regular deposits.

evidence.title: Internal Audit Report
evidence.description: An internal audit report from Acme Corporation detailing the missing funds.

evidence.title: Security Camera Footage Still
evidence.description: A still image from a security camera showing the defendant using an unauthorized computer terminal.

witnesses.name: Dr. Evelyn Reed
witnesses.bio: A forensic accountant who reviewed the financial records for the prosecution.

witnesses.name: Mr. Samuel Jones
witnesses.bio: A former colleague of the defendant who will testify for the defense.
